feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr vulnerable to privilege escalation
entry.content:
Dolibarr Open Source ERP & CRM for Business before v14.0.1 allows attackers to escalate privileges via a crafted API.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-43138
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/50248
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/commit/489cff46a37b04784d8e884af7fc2ad623bee17d
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gh7m-j673-wm97

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to XML External Entity
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 is vulnerable to XXE based DNS requests leading to IP disclosure.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-43689
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/8510-release-notes
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/913-release-notes
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/8.5.10
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/9.1.3
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2022-10-31
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q48r-xg9h-78m8

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to Improper Authentication
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 did not use strict comparison for the legacy_salt so that limited authentication bypass could occur if using this functionality. Remediate by updating to Concrete CMS 9.1.3+ or 8.5.10+.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-43690
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/8510-release-notes
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/913-release-notes
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/8.5.10
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/9.1.3
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2022-10-31
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q56r-mw39-944g

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to Improper Authentication
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 did not use strict comparison for the legacy_salt so that limited authentication bypass could occur if using this functionality. Remediate by updating to Concrete CMS 9.1.3+ or 8.5.10+.

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in icons since the Microsoft application tile color is not sanitized. Remediate by updating to Concrete CMS 9.1.3+ or 8.5.10+.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-43688
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/8510-release-notes
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/913-release-notes
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/8.5.10
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/9.1.3
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2022-10-31
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9jc5-9wh5-mc36

Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in icons since the Microsoft application tile color is not sanitized. Remediate by updating to Concrete CMS 9.1.3+ or 8.5.10+.

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to Session Fixation
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 does not issue a new session ID upon successful OAuth authentication. Remediate by updating to Concrete CMS 9.1.3+ or 8.5.10+.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-43687
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/8510-release-notes
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/913-release-notes
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/8.5.10
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/9.1.3
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2022-10-31
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m53v-5x5x-5m2p

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to Uncontrolled Resource Consumption leading to DoS
entry.content:
In Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2, the authTypeConcreteCookieMap table can be filled up causing a denial of service (high load).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-43686
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/8510-release-notes
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/913-release-notes
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/8.5.10
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/9.1.3
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2022-10-31
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3cxx-3f53-m92c

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting via multilingual report
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 is vulnerable to Reflected XSS in the multilingual report due to un-sanitized output. Remediate by updating to Concrete CMS 9.1.3+ or 8.5.10+.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-43967
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/8510-release-notes
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/913-release-notes

  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/9.1.3
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2022-10-31
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vq39-q549-g786

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via dashboard icons
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 is vulnerable to Reflected XSS in the dashboard icons due to un-sanitized output. Remediate by updating to Concrete CMS 9.1.3+ or 8.5.10+.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-43968

entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 is vulnerable to Reflected XSS in the dashboard icons due to un-sanitized output. Remediate by updating to Concrete CMS 9.1.3+ or 8.5.10+.

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to Reflected Cross-site Scripting
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 is vulnerable to Reflected XSS - user can cause an administrator to trigger reflected XSS with a url if the targeted administrator is using an old browser that lacks XSS protection. Remediate by updating to Concrete CMS 9.1.3+ or 8.5.10+.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-43692
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/8510-release-notes
  • https://documentation.concretecms.org/developers/introduction/version-history/913-release-notes
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/8.5.10
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/releases/9.1.3
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2022-10-31
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rg6w-c352-p8pg

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to Reflected Cross-site Scripting
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 is vulnerable to Reflected XSS - user can cause an administrator to trigger reflected XSS with a url if the targeted administrator is using an old browser that lacks XSS protection. Remediate by updating to Concrete CMS 9.1.3+ or 8.5.10+.

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to Reflected Cross-site Scripting via image manipulation library
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (formerly concrete5) below 8.5.10 and between 9.0.0 and 9.1.2 is vulnerable to Reflected XSS in the image manipulation library due to un-sanitized output.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-43694

entry.title: [backdrop/backdrop] Cross-site Scripting in Backdrop CMS
entry.content:
Backdrop CMS version 1.23.0 was discovered to contain a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability via Post content. The account must have admin privileges.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-42096
  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.23.0
  • https://github.com/bypazs/CVE-2022-42096
  • https://grimthereaperteam.medium.com/cve-2022-42096-backdrop-xss-at-posts-437c305036e2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g8jw-8vpv-pv5q
